thread.title: A Fan Was Reportedly Shot in the Head Following the Cowboys-Patriots Game
thread.title_full: A Fan Was Reportedly Shot in the Head Following the Cowboys-Patriots Game | Complex

author: Jordan Zirm
title: A Fan Was Reportedly Shot in the Head Following the Cowboys-Patriots Game
text:
According to the Arlington Police Department, a man in his early 50s suffered a gunshot wound to the head after being involved in an altercation in a parking lot near AT&T Stadium following the Cowboys-Patriots game this afternoon.
A fight in Lot 10 after Pats - Cowboys gm @ATTStadium . Victim shot in the head. Serious condition. Not fatal pic.twitter.com/dD1rfkryp7
— Clarence Hill (@clarencehilljr) October 12, 2015 The victim was airlifted to a nearby hospital, and the suspect, who tripped over a wall after the shooting, is in custody. The injuries to the victim were said to be serious, but not life-threatening. The fight began shortly after 8 p.m.
Even more disturbing? The suspect was said to be "egged on" by the crowd to shoot the victim.
Per eye witness, suspect was egged on by a crowd of people to kill the victim. #shooting #attstadium
— Clarence Hill (@clarencehilljr) October 12, 2015 .
[Via The Star-Telegram ]
